text: Anselm of Canterbury (1033â€”1109) was a former Archbishop of Canterbury who argued with William II over the authority of the Pope over English King. For this, he was exiled from England twice, but regained his position under Henry I. == References == Category:1030s births Category:1109 deaths Category:Archbishops of Canterbury Category:Christian saints Category:Italian philosophers Category:English theologians Category:Doctors of the Church
